text: Cytokine rescue from glucocorticoid induced apoptosis in T cells is mediated through inhibition of <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

We previously reported that dexamethasone ( DEX ) , a synthetic glucocorticoid , causes apoptosis in mature Th cell lines , and that this induction of cell death is prevented by specific cytokines , namely , by <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in Th1 cells and by <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in Th2 cells .

We now show that this differential rescue by specific cytokines in Th cells correlates with the level of <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that is regulated by DEX and cytokines .

text: In both cell types the cellular levels of <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and protein were evaluated by DEX treatment .

text: Interestingly , the DEX - mediated <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induction was completely inhibited by <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but not <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , in Th1 cells , while the reverse profile was seen in Th2 cells .

text: In both cell types , the cytokine that inhibits the induction of <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by DEX , also rescues these cells from DEX - induced apoptosis , although the rescue cytokine is different in Th1 and Th2 cells .

text: Our results imply that T cells need to maintain a certain level of NF-kappaB transcriptional activity in order to survive ; up - or down-regulation of nuclear NF kappaB through modulation of <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression by cytokines or DEX may lead to cell survival or cell death , respectively .
